intro: Languas subfusicarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited langues, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its bright red, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
